thread.title: Fujitsu scores $80m services contract with Link Group
thread.title_full: Fujitsu scores $80m services contract with Link Group | Business Spectator

author: Jennifer Foreshew
title: Fujitsu scores $80m services contract with Link Group
text:
Global financial services company Link Group has awarded Fujitsu an $80 million, five-year managed infrastructure services contract, expanding its existing relationship with the services provider.
The new contract will see Link Group’s existing Western Australian business and Superpartners migrated to Fujitsu’s delivery model currently used for Link Group (Eastern States). The delivery model under the new arrangement will include service desk, service delivery management, end-user services, network management, infrastructure support, data centre and project services. The services will be delivered via a combined onsite, onshore and offshore model utilising the Fujitsu Global Delivery Centre as well as local resources.
Link Group also aims to optimise IT spend across all entities to minimise risk and obtain cost efficiencies.
Link Group managing director John McMurtie said the decision to continue a proven relationship with Fujitsu would deliver the best value for IT spend over the next five years.
“In addition, we will continue to work with Fujitsu to ensure the highest standards relative to the security of data,’’ he said. “With the assurance of predictable IT costs delivered by this new services agreement, Link Group can better plan over the medium term.’’
Fujitsu Australia and New Zealand chief executive officer Mike Foster said the two companies had already shared a 10-year history.
“We are committed to our expanded role and to creating value for Link through innovation, reduction of risk and continuous improvement aligned with the Fujitsu Technology and Service Vision,’’ he said.
Link Group, whose customers include some of Australia’s largest superannuation funds and the world’s biggest corporations, expects to realise significant annual savings in IT spending across the business under the deal with Fujitsu.
The Group has acquired more than 35 local and international companies since 2004 and the recent acquisition of Superpartners almost doubled the size of the business.
